page.title: 13Ollerton Village
page.content: Ollerton Village was mentioned in the Domesday Book, and the nucleus of the village is still centred around the cobbled market square. The{many old buildings}include the Hop Pole Hotel, an ex-coaching inn;Ollerton Hall, a Georgian residence which is now in the process of being converted into a private nursing home;St.Giles Church, built in 1777; and a{working water-mill}built in the 18th century on the site of a medieval mill. Power for this is provided by the{River Maun},which flows through the village. The village centre is quite picturesque, and this, together with nearby{tourist attractions}such as the Major Oak,Ollerton Corner,Sherwood Forest Centre and the Dukeries means that Ollerton Village receives a fair number of visitors,mainly in summer.
